com.mumfrey.liteloader.api

Interface BrandingProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CustomisationProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LiteLoaderBrandingProvider

    public interface BrandingProvider
extends CustomisationProvider
    LiteLoader Extensible API - Branding Provider

    The Branding Provider manages loader branding alterations for a particular API. This is an optional API component which allows an API to specify customisations and additions to the loader environment in order to provide a more comfortable integration for the API.

    Since some branding options simply stack (like the API copyright notices for example) all APIs will be allowed to supply this information, however other options (like the main logo image) can only be set by one API. To determine which API should be used to set this information, the getPriority() method will be called and used to sort branding providers by priority, with highest priority winning.

    All branding options may return a null/not set value, allowing a branding provider to only override the branding features it wishes. Some options require a non-null value to be returned from a set of methods in order to take effect. eg. the logo option requires non-null return values from BOTH the getLogoResource() and getLogoCoords() methods.

    Author:
    Adam Mummery-Smith

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBrandingColour()
      Get the primary branding colour for this API, the branding provider should return 0 if it does not wish to override the branding colour.
      java.lang.String getCopyrightText()
      Get the copyright text for this API, used on the "about" screen, must not return null.
      java.lang.String getDisplayName()
      Get the display name for this API, used on the "about" screen, must not return null.
      java.net.URI getHomepage()
      Get the main home page URL for this API, used on the "about" screen, must not return null.
      Icon getIconCoords()
      Gets the coordinates of the icon logo as an IIcon instance, only called if getIconResource() returns a non-null value and the icon will only be used if BOTH methods return a valid object.
      ResourceLocation getIconResource()
      Get the resource to use for the icon logo (the chicken in the default setup), the API with the highest priority gets to define the icon logo, this method can return null if this API does not want to override the icon.
      Icon getLogoCoords()
      Gets the coordinates of the logo as an IIcon instance, only called if getLogoResource() returns a non-null value and the logo will only be used if BOTH methods return a valid object.
      ResourceLocation getLogoResource()
      Get the resource to use for the main logo, the API with the highest priority gets to define the logo, this method can return null if this API does not want to override the logo.
      int getPriority()
      Get the priority of this provider, higher numbers take precedence.
      Icon getTwitterAvatarCoords()
      If you wish to display a clickable twitter icon next to the API information, return the icon coordinates here.
      ResourceLocation getTwitterAvatarResource()
      If you wish to display a clickable twitter icon next to the API information, return the icon resource here.
      java.lang.String getTwitterUserName()
      If you wish to display a clickable twitter icon next to the API information in the "about" panel then you must return values from this method as well as getTwitterAvatarResource() and getTwitterAvatarCoords().

    • Method Detail

      • getPriority

        int getPriority()
        Get the priority of this provider, higher numbers take precedence. Some brandings can only be set by one provider (eg. the main "about" logo) so the branding provider with the highest priority will be the one which gets control of that feature.

      • getBrandingColour

        int getBrandingColour()
        Get the primary branding colour for this API, the branding provider should return 0 if it does not wish to override the branding colour. The branding colour is used for the mod list entries and hyper-links within the about GUI panels, the colour returned should be fully opaque.

      • getLogoResource

        ResourceLocation getLogoResource()
        Get the resource to use for the main logo, the API with the highest priority gets to define the logo, this method can return null if this API does not want to override the logo.

      • getLogoCoords

        Icon getLogoCoords()
        Gets the coordinates of the logo as an IIcon instance, only called if getLogoResource() returns a non-null value and the logo will only be used if BOTH methods return a valid object.

      • getIconResource

        ResourceLocation getIconResource()
        Get the resource to use for the icon logo (the chicken in the default setup), the API with the highest priority gets to define the icon logo, this method can return null if this API does not want to override the icon.

      • getIconCoords

        Icon getIconCoords()
        Gets the coordinates of the icon logo as an IIcon instance, only called if getIconResource() returns a non-null value and the icon will only be used if BOTH methods return a valid object.

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Get the display name for this API, used on the "about" screen, must not return null.

      • getCopyrightText

        java.lang.String getCopyrightText()
        Get the copyright text for this API, used on the "about" screen, must not return null.

      • getHomepage

        java.net.URI getHomepage()
        Get the main home page URL for this API, used on the "about" screen, must not return null.

      • getTwitterUserName

        java.lang.String getTwitterUserName()
        If you wish to display a clickable twitter icon next to the API information in the "about" panel then you must return values from this method as well as getTwitterAvatarResource() and getTwitterAvatarCoords(). Return the twitter user name here.

      • getTwitterAvatarResource

        ResourceLocation getTwitterAvatarResource()
        If you wish to display a clickable twitter icon next to the API information, return the icon resource here.

      • getTwitterAvatarCoords

        Icon getTwitterAvatarCoords()
        If you wish to display a clickable twitter icon next to the API information, return the icon coordinates here.
